definition: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed
to scold
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)

sentences.english: I identified with every Chekhov character.
sentences.chinese: 我与契诃夫笔下的每一个人物都能产生共鸣。

sentences.english: That was how Chekhov saw Jews.
sentences.chinese: 这就是契诃夫笔下的犹太人形象。

sentences.english: Chapter two expounds specifically on Chekhov novels'impressionism characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 第二章详细阐述契诃夫小说的印象主义特色。

sentences.english: My longest, and the most serious, relationship has been with Chekhov.
sentences.chinese: 契诃夫是我喜爱时间最长也是最令我执著的作家。

sentences.english: The writers Keats and Chekhoy had been doctors . T. S.
sentences.chinese: 作家济慈和契诃夫就曾做过医生。

sentences.english: The Cherry Orchard is a new type of Chekhovian modern comedy.
sentences.chinese: 《樱桃园》是一部“契诃夫式”的新型现代喜剧。

sentences.english: Yet, Chekhov remains the true literary love of my life.
sentences.chinese: 然而，契诃夫无疑仍是我人生中的文学挚爱。
